SW1P 3AE |youth_wing = [[Liberal Youth England]] }} The '''Liberal Democrats in England''', informally known as the '''English Liberal Democrats''', is the state party within the [[Liberal Democrats]] that operates in [[England]]. It is a [[federation]] of the eleven [[Regions of England|regional]] parties in England which are further divided into [[List of United Kingdom Parliament constituencies|local parties]]. The party currently holds 43 of the 533 English seats in the [[UK House of Commons]],{{cite web|url=http://www.statistics.gov.uk/geography/westminster.asp |title=Geography - Westminster parliamentary constituencies |publisher=Statistics.gov.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-06-24}}{{cite web|author=Äesky |url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom_general_election,_2010 |title=United Kingdom general election, 2010 - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia |publisher=En.wikipedia.org |date= |accessdate=2011-06-24}} 3 of the 25 seats in the [[London Assembly]] {{cite web|url=http://www.glalibdems.org.uk/ |title=London Assembly Liberal Democrats |publisher=Glalibdems.org.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-06-24}} and 11 of the 59 English seats in the [[European Parliament]]. ==Structure== ===English Council=== The English Council is the sovereign body of the English party. It consists of the chairs of regional parties, representatives elected by regional party members and representative of youth and other interest bodies that operate within the English party. The Council meets twice each year and elects an English Council Executive.http://libdems.org.uk/siteFiles/resources/PDF/Federal%20Constitution%20Feb%202010.pdf{{cite web|url=http://www.libdemvoice.org/the-english-party-welcomes-careful-and-discreet-participants-19885.html |title=The English Party welcomes careful, and discreet, participantsâ¦ |publisher=Libdemvoice.org |date=2010-06-08 |accessdate=2011-06-24}}{{cite web|url=http://www.libdemvoice.org/english-council-20166.html |title=If English Council meets and nobody knows, did it really meet? |publisher=Libdemvoice.org |date=2010-07-05 |accessdate=2011-06-24}} A Finance and Administration Sub-Committee which is chaired by a Treasurer manages the finances of the English party. ===English Council Executive=== The English Council Executive consists of 12 members elected by the English Council. The elections to the current English Council Executive took place in November 2010 (apart from the Liberal Youth representative, who is elected in June every year) and its members are as follows:{{cite web|url=http://www.libdemvoice.org/english-party-election-results-2010-22028.html?utm_source=twitterfeed&utm_medium=twitter |title=English Party election results 2010 |publisher=Libdemvoice.org |date=2010-11-11 |accessdate=2011-06-24}} *Nigel Ashton *Stan Collins (ECE Vice-Chair) *Dawn Davidson *Kay Friend *Anders Hanson *Sean Hooker *Sal Jarvis *Steve Jarvis (Treasurer) *Brian Orrell (ECE Chair) *Geoff Payne *Neil Walton *Mike Wheatley *TBA (Liberal Youth England) ;Elected office holders in the English party *Chair of the Liberal Democrats in England: [[Jonathan Davies (politician)|Jonathan Davies]] {{cite web|url=http://www.cix.co.uk/~rosenstiel/ldelections/09english.htm |title=English elections 2009 |publisher=Cix.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-06-24}}{{cite web|last=Valladares |first=Mark |url=http://liberalbureaucracy.blogspot.com/2009/11/english-party-is-election-of-new-chair.html |title=The view from Creeting St Peter: English Party - is the election of a new Chair not worth reporting? |publisher=Liberalbureaucracy.blogspot.com |date=2009-11-14 |accessdate=2011-06-24}} *Chair of the English Council Executive: [[Brian Orrell]] *Chair of English Candidates' Committee: [[Margaret Joachim]] ;English party representatives on federal party committees * English party representative on the Federal Executive: [[Brian Orrell]] * English party representative on the Federal Policy Committee: [[Geoff Payne]] * English party representative on the Federal Conference Committee: [[Geoff Payne]] ==Regional parties== The English party a federation of the eleven regional parties which follow the boundaries of the [[English Regions]] with the exception of [[South East England]] and [[South West England]] which are each divided into two regional parties.http://member.libdems.org.uk/~members/liberaldemocrats/node/25?tid=19 Each regional party is governed by a conference and AGM which takes place in autumn of every year. The conference elects a Regional Executive, led by a Regional Chair. The regional executive includes all Liberal Democrat [[Members of Parliament]] with constituencies within the region, all Members of the [[House of Lords]] that are members of the regional party, all Liberal Democrat [[Members of the European Parliament]] that represent the region, ordinary party members elected from within the region and additional members co-opted by the executive.{{cite web|url=http://www.cix.co.uk/~libdemnorwest/REGIONALCONSTITUTION1_4.RTF |title=North West Liberal Democrats Â« Lib Dems in Cheshire, Cumbria, Greater Manchester, Lancashire and Merseyside |publisher=Cix.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-06-24}} The regional parties within the English party are: *Devon and Cornwall ([[South West England|South West]]) *[[East of England]] *[[East Midlands]] *[[Greater London]] *[[North East England|North East]] *[[North West England|North West]] *South Central ([[South East England|South East]]) *South East ([[South East England|South East]]) *Western Counties ([[South West England|South West]]) *[[West Midlands (region)|West Midlands]] *[[Yorkshire and the Humber]] ==Policy and functions== The English party has responsibilities for the organisation of local parties, co-ordination of the activities of regional parties, resolution of disputes between regional parties, selection of English representatives to federal bodies and establishing the rules for selection of party candidates.{{cite web|last=Valladares |first=Mark |url=http://liberalbureaucracy.blogspot.com/2009/10/game-on-for-leadership-of-english.html |title=The view from Creeting St Peter: Game on for leadership of the English Liberal Democrats |publisher=Liberalbureaucracy.blogspot.com |date=2009-10-18 |accessdate=2011-06-24}} The English Party constitution states that the Liberal Democrats in England "shall determine the policy of the Party on matters affecting England which fall outside the remit of the Federal Party" This can be achieved by structures established by the English Council.http://www.libdems.org.uk/siteFiles/resources/PDF/Constitution.pdf As no policy making structures are currently in place, policy making has been passed up to federal level and English policies discussed at federal party conferences.{{cite web|url=http://www.libdems.org.uk/how_we_make_policy.aspx |title=The Liberal Democrats, How We Make Policy |publisher=Libdems.org.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-06-24}} ==See also== *[[Liberal Democrats]] *[[Scottish Liberal Democrats]] *[[Welsh Liberal Democrats]] *[[Northern Ireland Liberal Democrats]]
